comments.body: In cases of an invalid combination of parameters, I would like to rely on server-side validation raising an error. However, it seems that this scenario might actually be accepted, so I would agree that either warning or error on the module side is nice, because otherwise user would be left without any indication.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +188,192 @@
                if (scm_update_cache_timeout is not None) and (scm_update_on_launch is not True):
                    module.warn('scm_update_cache_timeout will be ignored since scm_update_on_launch was not set to true')

                result = project.modify(name=name, description=description,

comments.body: not sure if this is correct documentation, let me check against my server...
no, never mind, this is correct. This field takes the absolute path including the venv root, so this is good documentation.
